verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, saying,
verses.comment: Standard opening formula for divine communication.

verses.text: "Command the Israelites to give to the Levites cities to dwell in from among the inheritance of their possession. You shall also give the Levites pasturelands around the cities.
verses.comment: ‘Pasturelands’ conveys ‘suburbs’ or surrounding fields.

verses.text: The cities shall be theirs to live in, and their pasturelands shall be for their cattle, their herds, and all their animals.
verses.comment: No major difference; specifies animals.

verses.text: The pasturelands of the cities you shall give to the Levites shall extend from the wall of the city outward one thousand cubits all around.
verses.comment: ‘Cubits’ is an ancient measurement; not converted.

verses.text: Measure two thousand cubits outside the city on the east side, two thousand on the south side, two thousand on the west side, and two thousand on the north side, with the city in the middle. This area shall be their pasturelands for the cities.
verses.comment: ‘Two thousand cubits’ for dimensions; ‘suburbs’ rendered ‘pasturelands’.

verses.text: The cities that you shall give to the Levites shall include six cities of refuge, to which anyone who has killed someone may flee. In addition to them, you shall give forty-two other cities.
verses.comment: ‘Killed’ conveys manslaughter; number specified.

verses.text: All the cities that you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities, together with their pasturelands.
verses.comment: Exact total given for clarity.

verses.text: And as for the cities which you shall give from the possession of the Israelites, from the larger tribes you shall give more; from the smaller tribes you shall give fewer. Each tribe shall give cities to the Levites in proportion to its inheritance.
verses.comment: Proportional giving according to size of tribal inheritance.

verses.text: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Another instance of divine speech formula.

verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them, 'When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.comment: Instruction to be followed after entering the land.

verses.text: you shall select cities for yourselves to be cities of refuge, so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there.
verses.comment: ‘Unintentionally’ conveys accidental killing.

verses.text: These cities shall be places of refuge from the avenger, so that the manslayer may not die until he stands before the congregation for judgment.
verses.comment: ‘Avenger’ is the ‘goel’, i.e., family redeemer.

verses.text: The cities which you shall provide shall be six cities of refuge for you.
verses.comment: Number repeated for emphasis.

verses.text: You shall give three cities of refuge on the east side of the Jordan, and three cities you shall give in the land of Canaan. These shall be cities of refuge.
verses.comment: Distribution specified by geography.

verses.text: These six cities shall be for refuge for the Israelites, the foreigner, and the sojourner among them, so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there.
verses.comment: ‘Foreigner and sojourner’ undeviatingly translated.

verses.text: "But if someone strikes another with an iron object, so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: ‘Put to death’ = capital punishment per Torah.

verses.text: If he strikes him with a stone in the hand, by which a person could die, and he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Incident described with details.

verses.text: Or if he strikes him with a wooden object in the hand, by which a person could die, and he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Parallel to previous verses; instruments listed.

verses.text: The avenger of blood himself shall put the murderer to death; when he meets him, he shall put him to death.
verses.comment: ‘Avenger of blood’ = family redeemer; justice function.

verses.text: If he pushes him out of hatred, or throws something at him intentionally, and he dies,
verses.comment: Deliberate action distinguishes from accidental.

verses.text: or if he strikes him with his hand in enmity so that he dies, the one who struck him shall surely be put to death; he is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.
verses.comment: Again, responsibility of the avenger emphasized.

verses.text: "But if he pushes him suddenly without enmity, or throws any object at him without intent,
verses.comment: Contrast: unintentional killing.

verses.text: or without seeing him drops a stone on him, by which he could die, and he dies, without being his enemy or seeking to harm him,
verses.comment: Scenario of accidental death detailed.

verses.text: then the congregation shall judge between the one who struck him and the avenger of blood according to these rules.
verses.comment: Community judicial responsibility in manslaughter.

verses.text: The congregation shall deliver the manslayer from the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall send him back to the city of refuge to which he fled. He shall live there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
verses.comment: Manslayer must remain until high priest dies; ‘holy oil’ specified.

verses.text: But if the manslayer at any time goes outside the border of his city of refuge to which he fled,
verses.comment: Emphasizes conditions of refuge.

verses.text: and the avenger of blood finds him outside the city of refuge, and the avenger kills the manslayer, he shall not be guilty of blood,
verses.comment: Avenger not held liable if manslayer leaves protection.

verses.text: because the manslayer should have stayed in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest, the manslayer may return to the land of his possession.
verses.comment: Release of manslayer corresponds to high priest's death.

verses.text: These things shall be for a statute of judgment for you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.comment: Law is permanent for future generations.

verses.text: "Anyone who kills a person shall be put to death as a murderer only on the evidence of witnesses. No one shall be put to death on the testimony of one witness.
verses.comment: Due process: at least two witnesses required.

verses.text: You shall accept no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death; he shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Capital crimes not redeemable by payment.

verses.text: And you shall accept no ransom for him who has fled to a city of refuge, so that he may return to live in the land before the death of the high priest.
verses.comment: No release for manslayer by payment; only at high priest’s death.

verses.text: You shall not pollute the land in which you are. For blood pollutes the land, and no atonement can be made for the land for the blood that is shed in it, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
verses.comment: Theology of blood guilt; only the blood of the murderer atones.

verses.text: Do not defile the land in which you live, in which I dwell. For I, the LORD, dwell among the Israelites."
verses.comment: Emphasis on God’s presence among His people as rationale.
